Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates by stating that the minimum legal drinking age in the U.S. is being raised to 25, when in fact there was no such law or practice implemented.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that the minimum drinking ages in the U.S. are established on a state-by-state basis, not mandated nationally by federal law.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as there is no evidence or factual basis provided to support the statement that the drinking age was raised to 25.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that there was an agreement at the White House to change the legal drinking age to 25, without providing any evidence or sources to support this assumption.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim can be explained as a hoax or prank created by a website that allows users to create fake news and trick others.
